sentences: Minu eesm√§rk on laenata rohkem teadmisi.
Kas saab see raamat olla laenatav?
context: 'Laenata' is the infinitive form of the Estonian verb meaning 'to borrow'. It can also be used as a past tense particle when combined with another verb. In everyday language, it often appears in sentences where someone has taken something temporarily from another person or an institution.
